text: I'm always looking for new ways to
incorporate heart-healthy wild salmon
and more vegetables into my diet and
this recipe has both its wild salmon
with edamame cauliflower rice super
simple just a handful of ingredients
let's get started so I have one head of
large cauliflower and what I did here
was just took off the stem end and broke
up the florets into like 1-inch pieces
or so you don't want to put two larger
pieces in the food processor because
we're shooting for pulsed rice grains
versus a puree so definitely do this in
two batches all right that looks great
we're time what you're looking for is
really finely ground cauliflower but not
too fine we wanted to have a little bit
of texture so transfer this to a rimmed
baking sheet riced cauliflower is such
an interesting versatile ingredient it's
a great way to incorporate more
vegetables into your meals it's a great
way also if you're trying to look for a
grain free alternative that still feels
pretty substantial this is something
that you can make very easily at home by
just pulsing up a cauliflower and the
food processor but I've also been seeing
already prepared rice cauliflower in the
produce section of a lot of grocery
stores so if you're going that route you
need to start with about six cups but
this is so easy who wouldn't want to do
this so with our second batch
pulse till finally ground all right that
was excellent
have this to the sheet pan cauliflower
interestingly enough is really high in
vitamin C so you can also make rice -
cauliflower if you don't have a food
processor what you would do is just
break down the cauliflower head into the
florets and then braid it on a box

definitely an option so I have my
beautiful pulsed cauliflower so drizzle
this with three tablespoons of olive oil
you want to make sure you use enough
olive oil because we want to get a
little bit of crispy crunchy around the
edges season it with salt and pepper and
then I already sliced two scallions just
take a good handful about half of this
sprinkle on top and give it a good stir
make sure everything is nice and
incorporated so I really love roasting
riced cauliflower because you get some
of the nice crispy caramelized edges you
can also cook this by sauteing
super-easy but I'd say roasting is
definitely my favorite in we go so I
have my oven preheated to 425 and this
is gonna roast until again it's just a
little caramelized and crispy around the
edges about 30 minutes okay it's been
about half an hour this smells so good
those nice little caramelized bits so to
the roasted cauliflower add one cup of
shelled edamame I used frozen here this
is thawed this not only adds a nice
amount of color texture great flavor but
also a nice
little hit of protein so mix this all
together now last but not least our wild
salmon I have four fillets here they're
about six ounces each make sure you're
looking for wild if you can't find fresh
look for frozen great product so season
this with a little bit of salt pepper

this is going to roast about eight
